history.content: I'm not entirely sure about that, but I also don't think the CoE has made a new P/NP policy. I believe the decision will only be out on Nov 30th, though I may be wrong?

children.subject: Oh, I'm so sorry about that. I may have misread your earlier message. But yes, I would advise contacting your advisor about that, because we're all pretty clueless and anxious about what is to come.

Why would you post the above in the student response if it doesn't answer the question, @Student Response? As for the new P/NP policy, I was talking about what is likely to be passed on the 30th, which is what the CoE has already recommended, which can be found here: https://engineering.berkeley.edu/students/covid/pnp-policy-2020-21/
As with many, many questions on this Piazza...ask your advisor, they can answer this much better than the students here

history.content: I'm currently taking 5 units P/NP and 7 units (spread over two courses) for a letter grade. As per the new CoE P/NP policy, if I were to use both my P/NPs on the two courses I'm currently taking for a letter grade, would I end up with a semester GPA of 0.0 and subsequently be placed on academic probation?
history.subject: CoE P/NP clarification
